Record date: 2085-11-01
November 01, 2085
Usha Gibbons, MD
Cooley Internal Medicine Associates
Cooley Dickinson Hospital
49 Greenfield Drive
Schuyler, FL 76969
RE: BENITEZ, Wonda
MRN: 892-76-95-4
Dear Usha:
I had the pleasure of seeing one of your patients, Ms. Benitez, in
my Cardiovascular Clinic today for follow-up status post coronary
artery bypass surgery. As you know, Ms. Benitez has been having a
terrible past month with increasing episodes of substernal chest
discomfort. One episode occurred during Ramadan when she was
fasting and another occurred while she was in a restaurant. Both of
these episodes were relieved with sublingual nitroglycerine. I
am concerned about her discomfort because of an earlier
Persantine MIBI study showing anteroapical redistribution on her
test and the fact that it was relieved by nitroglycerine.
Currently she denies any PND, orthopnea or chest discomfort. She
continues to have back and bilateral hip pain and has been taking
corticosteroid shots for that.
On physical examination, she is an anxious, concerned, elderly
woman. Blood pressure is 160/70 in the left arm. Jugular venous
pulse is not observed. She has bilateral carotid bruits. Chest
exam is clear. Cardiac exam shows an S4 gallop, a normal S1, a
physiologically split S2 and a 2/6 systolic murmur at the left
sternal border. Abdominal exam is benign. Peripheral exam shows
trace pedal edema.
EKG shows sinus bradycardia at a rate of 50 beats per minute.
There are Q waves in V1 through V4, consistent with an old
anterolateral MI. The tracing was otherwise unchanged compared
with previous tracings.
RE: BENITEZ, Wonda
MRN: 892-76-95-4 - 2 - November 01, 2085
IMPRESSION: I think we should schedule Ms. Benitez for a
Persantine thallium test as soon as possible. If she can
exercise on this test, that would be even better. When the
results are back, I will get back you regarding further
recommendations. My hope is that we will not have to
revascularize her again. If we do, I am hoping to do so with
potential angioplasty and stenting. In the meantime, I have
switched her from Zocor 40 mg to Lipitor 40 mg a day in the hopes
of targeting her LDL cholesterol to the new guidelines of 100.
Her previous LDL cholesterol was 111. I also suggested to her in
the meantime to cut down on her physical activities until we know
the results of the thallium test and also to forgo one episode of
her steroid injection for her back.
Please let me know if you have any further questions or concerns
regarding this patient. Again, thank you for referring her to
our clinic.
With warm regards,
Gordon Q. Iniguez, MD
GI/JZ
